Brooklyn Historical Society
Brooklyn Dodgers collection
Los Angeles Dodgers (Baseball team)
Brooklyn Dodgers (Baseball team)
ARC.297
6.75 Linear Feet in six manuscript boxes, three flat boxes, and one flat file drawer
1884-2002 1941-1957 The collection contains scorecards, programs, yearbooks, magazines, clippings, scrapbooks, posters, and other items related to the Brooklyn Dodgers, dating from 1884 to 2002, which have been collection by Brooklyn Historical Society. It also includes a small amount of items related to the Los Angeles Dodgers and pre-Brooklyn Dodgers baseball teams. Of note are several late 19th century Brooklyn baseball scorecards.
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright status of individual items vary. Please consult library staff for more information.
Conditions Governing Access
Audio and video cassette recordings are not currently accessible. Otherwise open to researchers without restriction.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Dodgers collection, ARC.297, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Related Materials

Eckford Social Club scrapbook, 1871-1961 (1991.049)
Larry Trapani Brooklyn Dodgers collection, 1941-1957 (2005.037)
Los Angeles Dodgers centennial press kit photographs, circa 1990 (V1991.004)
Quigley collection of Baseball memorabilia, 1943-1973 (2007.052)
Walter O'Malley Brooklyn Dodgers records, 1946-1957 (ARC.294)
William Watson Clark scrapbook, circa 1928-1938 (2011.006)
Image collections:
Brooklyn Dodgers photographs, 1949–1956 (V1987.001)
Brooklyn Dodgers Spring Training photographs (2015.023)
Brooklyn Dodgers team photographs, 1953 (V1987.019)
Chuck Connors photographs, 1938-1987 (V1987.012)
Collection of Brooklyn Dodgers photographic portraits, circa 1940-1957 (ARC.265)
Other photographs: V1973.5.1804 - V1973.5.1806; V1973.5.3678; V1974.39.44; V1982.5.20; V1984.1.639; V1987.5.1 a,b; V1987.16.1; V1987.19.1 - V1987.19.5; V1989.30.24; V1990.18.1; V1990.35.1; V1991.4.1 - V1991.4.2; V1991.52.1; V1993.10.1 - V1993.10.9
Additional photographs can be found by using the search term "Brooklyn Dodgers" in the BHS in-house image database.
Oral histories:
Ebbets Field – Dodgers Oral History, 2010
Arrangement
The collection is organized into five series:
Series 1: Official publications and scorecards
Series 2: Clippings and scrapbooks
Series 3: Memorabilia and ephemera
Series 4: Photographs and art
Series 5: Jackie Robinson Conference
Processing Information
This collection was originally part of the Brooklyn Ephemera collection (ARC.272). Due to its size and frequency of use, the Dodgers ephemera was removed to create this separate collection in March 2015. The collection was organized into series and the finding aid was revised in August 2015. The Jackie Robinson Conference materials (Series 5) were added to the collection in June 2016.
New Brooklyn Dodgers items will be added to this collection as they accrue. Last updated January 2017.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donor information has been noted on folders when available.
Donations include:
"When the Dodgers Left New York," lyrics by Tim Horrigan (Gift of Tim Horrigan, 1986)
World Series identification card, 1955, Walter O'Malley business card, and other ephemera (Gift of Irving Rudd, 1988)
Russ Meyer baseball card, 1955, and Sal Maglie baseball card, 1957 (Gift of Ellen Snyder, 1988)
Harry Lumley baseball card, 1909, and William Bergen baseball card, 1911 (Gift of Lew Lipset, circa 1988)
Score book pages, kept by Lothar Stelter, 1946 (Gift of Larry Stelter, 1992)
The Dodgers All-Time Greats - A Pictoral History - 1890-1970's and Danny Goodman - Concessions - Dodger Stadium 7" vinyl record (Gift of Lois Greene Stone, 1998)
"A World Series Remembrance: The Brooklyn Dodgers vs. The New York Yankees, 1947" lithograph by Jim Annis (Gift of Jim Annis, 2002, 2002.006)
Programs, scorecards, yearbooks, ticket stubs, audio recordings, and pennant, 1940s-1990s (Gift of Joseph P. Cogan, 2005)
1940 game diary (scrapbook), and World Series ticket stubs, 1947, 1955 (Gift of Albert Greenberg, 2005, 2005.029)
1950 program and scorecard, and 1955 Brooklyn Dodgers anniversary magazine, 1996 (Gift of Michael Colin, 2011).
Brooklyn Dodgers official cover series binder, 1988 (Gift of Peter O'Malley, 2015.002)
One copy of The Boys of Summer, by Roger Kahn, New York: Harper & Row, first edition, signed by Duke Snider, 1972; one baseball signed by Bobby Thomson and Ralph Branca, 1990s; one copy of the September 22, 1947 issue of Time magazine featuring Jackie Robinson on the cover; one copy of the September 1957 issue of Sport magazine, featuring Duke Snider on the cover, signed by Duke Snider; and sheet music for "The Brooklyn Dodgers Jump," by George T. Simon and Joe Ricardel, signed by Duke Snider, 1949 (Gift of Richard C. Atkins, 2015.032)
Two scrapbooks, 1941-1954 (Gift of Claire Lambkin, date unknown)
Line Drives from the Dodgers newsletters, 1944-1956 (Gift of Frank Michel, date unknown)
Los Angeles Dodgers yearbook, 1958 (Gift of Mrs. Kenn Stryker-Rodda, date unknown)
Scope and Contents
The collection contains scorecards, programs, yearbooks, magazines, clippings, scrapbooks, posters, and other items related to the Brooklyn Dodgers, dating from 1884 to 2002, which have been collection by Brooklyn Historical Society. It also includes a small amount of items related to the Los Angeles Dodgers and pre-Brooklyn Dodgers baseball teams. Of note are several late 19th century Brooklyn baseball scorecards.
Other Finding Aids
Item-level descriptions of photographs and artwork are available in the BHS in-house image database

Series 1: Official publications and scorecards210961884-1991
Scope and Contents
The series contains scorecards, programs, World Series programs, newsletters, and yearbooks, dating from 1884 to 1991. In addition to the Brooklyn Dodgers, the series include scorecards from earlier Brooklyn baseball teams, as well as some material relating to the Los Angeles Dodgers.Scorecards211031884-19461Program and scorecard2112119505Programs and scorecards211041953-19571World Series programs211051941-19551Newsletters211061944-19561Yearbooks211071949-19561Yearbooks211081949-19572Los Angeles Dodgers yearbook2110919582Dodgers Centennial yearbooks2112819906Los Angeles Dodgers yearbook2112919916Series 2: Clippings and scrapbooks210971900-20024
Scope and Contents

Scope and Contents
The series contains assorted memorabilia and ephemera, including calendars, ticket stubs, baseball cards, postcards, audio recordings, posters, and a pennant, dating from 1909 to circa 2002. It also contains a file relating to an unrealized new stadium in Brooklyn, dating from 1981 to 1984. Of note are several early 20th century baseball cards and one copy of the first edition of The Boys of the Summer, by Roger Kahn, signed by Duke Snider.The Boys of Summer, by Roger Kahn, first edition, signed by Duke Snider2263319725Calendars211101990-19912Ticket stubs211141941-19573Baseball cards211151909-19863Postcards21116circa 1970s3New Brooklyn stadium ephemera211171981-19843Miscellaneous ephemera211181950s-19903"The Brooklyn Dodgers Jump" sheet music, signed by Duke Snider2263419495"When the Dodgers Left New York," lyrics by Tim Horrigan21122198553 audio recordings (7" and 10" vinyl records)211251949-19576Danny Goodman - Concessions - Dodger Stadium 7" vinyl record6710019654

Scope and Contents
The series contains a 1954 photograph of Pee Wee Reese at bat versus the Chicago Cubs; a 1955 Dodgers group photograph signed by Clem Labine; and a lithograph of Ebbets Field, entitled "A World Series Remembrance: The Brooklyn Dodgers vs. The New York Yankees, 1947," produced by Jim Annis in 2002.Pee Wee Reese at bat photograph2110119546Brooklyn Dodgers team group photograph2110019556
General
Reproduction print signed by Clem Labine. Accessioned as V1997.065."A World Series Remembrance: The Brooklyn Dodgers vs. The New York Yankees, 1947" lithograph by Jim Annis211022002Flat File A - Drawer 5Series 5: Jackie Robinson Conference658321997
Scope and Contents
The series contains material related to the Jackie Robinson: Race, Sports and the American Dream Conference, which was held at Long Island University's Brooklyn campus in April 1997. It includes programs, press releases, brochures, and other printed ephemera, as well as 38 audio cassette tape recordings of the conference.Jackie Robinson Conference audio cassette tapes and ephemera6583319978
